CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 1A, reads: "Lynn V. Hooe Sr." Portion of accompanying article reads: "Lynn V. Hooe Sr. and Paul Thompson - Two Negroes Earn High Scout Awards - Two Negroes were among 19 outstanding volunteer leaders receiving the Silver Beaver Award at the annual meeting of the Boy Scouts of America at Syria Mosque, Monday night. They are Lynn V. Hooe Sr., of 3119 Iowa St., Troop 93, and Paul E. Thompson of 921 Adelaide St.  Hooe was cited as an 'excellent Scoutmaster, with 20 years of service who instills in each of his boys the true spirit of scouting.  He helped organize many units in his district and has aided in training their new leaders... "Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 20, 1962, pg. 6, reads: "To Receive Award - Scoutmaster Lynn V. Hooe Sr. of Troop 93 will receive the Florence S. Reizenstein Human Relations Award at the Youth Division rally of the Pittsburgh NAACP, on Sunday at 5 P.M., in Calvary Baptist Church."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Scoutmaster Lynn Hooe Sr. from Troop 93 wearing Scout uniform and Silver Beaver award around neck, posed in front of wood or moire wall in Syria Mosque
